metadata.titleEn: Data set of metallogenic regionalization of pegmatitic rare-metals in western Yunnan  (2019-2022)
metadata.description: 1) the western yunnan pegmatite type rare metal mineralization zoning into gaoligong mountains metallogenic belt, tengchong - lianghe metallogenic belt, cimo metallogenic belt, and phoenix city - lincang metallogenic belt and so on four metallogenic belt, metadata contains information ore belt is as follows: the main mineral rock, rock characteristics, the main mineral, rare metal mineralization mainly elements, diagenetic mineralization ages.Gaoligong mountains metallogenic belt rare metal pegmatite may cause for deep penetrating, its orebody mainly produce Yu Zhongshen metamorphic tectonic fissures, other three metallogenic belt rare metal pegmatite and its nearby granite has a close genetic relationship, its orebody mainly output within the granite rock body, inner and outer contact zone or away from the rock mass of the structure of the surrounding rock fracture.Mineralization age concentrated in the Himalayan period, the mineralization age concentrated in the Himalayan period, covers the paleocene, Eocene, Oligocene and Miocene four metallogenic period, its age range is mainly focused on the 62-15 ma.The age range as the main focus on 62-15 ma.2) data from the field "synthetical consolidation and rehabilitation field geological work and literature.3) data on high credibility, has practical application value.4) as the western yunnan pegmatite type rare metal ore provides the foundation, pointed out the direction.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to gather information about the mineralization age and rock characteristics in rare metal pegmatite mineralization zones?
Example.Answer: Data collection methods include field geological work and comprehensive literature review, focusing on the mineralization age and characteristics of major rock types and rare metal minerals within the pegmatite mineralization zones in western Yunnan.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the determination of mineralization ages ranging from 62-15Ma in the formation of rare metal pegmatite belts?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The mineralization ages ranging from 62-15Ma are concentrated in the Himalayan period, covering Paleocene, Eocene, Oligocene, and Miocene epochs. This is due to the geological processes that occurred during these timeframes, which influenced the formation and mineralization in the pegmatite belts of western Yunnan.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the objective of collecting and organizing data from the rare metal mineralization zones in the western Yunnan pegmatite field?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The objective of collecting and organizing data from the rare metal mineralization zones in western Yunnan is to provide a foundational basis and guidance for exploring rare metal resources in pegmatite deposits. The data aims to delineate different metallogenic belts, characterize their geological features, and understand their mineralization processes, which can aid in efficient resource exploration and assessment.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What procedural methodologies are employed to collect and validate geological data for delineating rare metal mineralization zones in pegmatite regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Data collection involves field-based geological surveys and comprehensive literature reviews. The surveys are conducted to gather metadata on characteristics such as major rock minerals, surrounding rock features, and mineralization elements. The data is then validated through its application in guiding rare metal prospecting in Western Yunnan pegmatite-type mineralization zones.
